name: Pork Tenderloin with Honey Garlic Sauce
description: Recipe VIDEO above. Tender, succulent pork fillet seasoned with a rub, seared until golden then baked in a Honey Garlic Sauce until sticky on the outside and juicy on the inside. Simply incredible! (And really, it's SIMPLE!)
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 tbsp soy sauce, light or all purpose ((Note 2))

recipeInstructions.text: Mix Rub ingredients then sprinkle over the pork.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix Rub ingredients then sprinkle over the pork.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large oven proof skillet (Note 3) over high heat. Add pork and sear until golden all over.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a large oven proof skillet (Note 3) over high heat. Add pork and sear until golden all over.

recipeInstructions.text: When pork is almost seared, push to the side, add garlic and cook until golden.
recipeInstructions.name: When pork is almost seared, push to the side, add garlic and cook until golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour sauce in. Turn pork once, then immediately transfer to the oven.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour sauce in. Turn pork once, then immediately transfer to the oven.

recipeInstructions.text: Roast 15 - 18 minutes or until the internal temperature is 68C / 155F (Note 4).
recipeInstructions.name: Roast 15 - 18 minutes or until the internal temperature is 68C / 155F (Note 4).

recipeInstructions.text: Remove pork onto plate, cover loosely with foil and rest 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove pork onto plate, cover loosely with foil and rest 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Place skillet with sauce on stove over medium high heat, simmer rapidly for 3 minutes until liquid reduces down to thin syrup.
recipeInstructions.name: Place skillet with sauce on stove over medium high heat, simmer rapidly for 3 minutes until liquid reduces down to thin syrup.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from stove, put pork in and turn to coat in sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from stove, put pork in and turn to coat in sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut pork into thick slices and serve with sauce!
recipeInstructions.name: Cut pork into thick slices and serve with sauce!

review.reviewBody:
We loved this dish! Easy and great flavor..also the cooking to 155 was spot on! 
Nagi, your website has inspired me many times when I don't know what to make for dinner or whatever meal....I used to be a chef in SF and love all your recipes. Keep them coming!
The Honey Garlic Sauce does not contain garlic.  Is this because the garlic is cooked separately in the pan with the pork loin?
I love this recipe.  We had it again last night, served with mashed cauliflower, beans and creamy leeks.  Amazing!  Thanks Nagi.  Your recipes never disappoint.
I've made this so many times now - always a winner. Thank you for sharing! Love!

ME ENCANTÓ ESTA RECETA Y SOBRETODO LOS COMENTARIOS Y NOTAS ESPECIFICAS POR CAMBIOS POSIBLES EN LA RECETA Y LAS SUGERIENCIAS DE ACOMPAÑAMIENTOS FABULOSO! MUCHAS GRACIAS POR COMPARTIRLO. EN CUANTO PUEDA COMPRARE TUS LIBROS.
Loved this recipe, I ended up cooking the pork for just the 15mins, followed everything else and it turned out amazing,  so nice and juicy!  Would make again in a heartbeat
I've been making this for possibly a couple of years now. Always a family favourite. Easy and delicious
Best pork tenderloin recipe if followed to the T.  This is the one.  No need to look any further.
Fantastic recipe. Thanks so much.  It’s a new family favourite

This is the second time I have cooked this recipe as hubby requested it again. Both times I substituted maple syrup for the honey. Luckily I have a meat probe with my oven so the pork was lovely and juicy at this temperature. The first time I served it with mashed potato and vegetables. This time with rice and salad as it’s summer here in Aus. Thanks Nagi!

Nagi, I don't consider myself a chef, but this pork was delicious and so succulent. And it was so easy!!
I took the advice from one of the reviews and doubled up on the quantity of rub. A good move I think.
After 15 minutes in the oven the internal temperature was already 160F; cooked to perfection. I probably reduced the sauce a little too much, but it made it so thick & yummy. 
Definitely a hit with us and our dinner guests. 
Thank you Nagi. 

Kevin - Stratford Upon Avon UK
